name: anchovy, capture by steel purse seiner and landing whole, fresh | landed anchovy by-catch, fresh | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/21989/documentation

This activity represents capture and landing of anchovy species (Engraulis spp.) by steel purse seiners. The life cycle inventories were produced based on a large representative sample of Peruvian and Spanish vessels and their activities. ;System boundaries and relation between activities

From vessel use and maintenance phases, including all upstream activities

Port landing operations are excluded from the system boundary.
category: A:Agriculture, forestry and fishing/03:Fishing and aquaculture/031:Fishing/0311:Marine fishing

processDocumentation.timeDescription: Data corresponds to the landings-weighted average of annual operations in anchovy (Engraulis spp.) fisheries between 2006 and 2016.
processDocumentation.geographyDescription: Anchovy species (Engraulis spp.) is captured in different parts of the world, including the Cantabrian Sea and the West South American Coast
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Current technology deployed includes purse seining and advanced fish detection equipment, including satellital data.
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: Valid for all GLO: extraploated from PE and ES, uncertainty adjusted accordingly.

exchanges.description: By-catch for European anchovy includes other small-pelagics, such as mackerel (Scomber scombrus) or European pilchard (Sardina pilchardus). Moreover, by-catch includes a small amount of tunids. The values is calculated as a weighted average from the two regional activities in Peru and Spain. Production volume was used as weight. Peruvian PV: 4212000000 kg, Spanish PV: 7000000 kg.

flow.name: landed anchovy by-catch, fresh
flow.category: A:Agriculture, forestry and fishing/03:Fishing and aquaculture/031:Fishing/0311:Marine fishing

exchanges.description: Ice consumed for 1000 kg of landed anchovy on board. The values is calculated as a weighted average from the two regional activities in Peru and Spain. Production volume was used as weight. Peruvian PV: 4212000000 kg, Spanish PV: 7000000 kg.

exchanges.description: Construction of a purse seiner, per 1000 kg of light ship weight (LSW). Regressions based on mainly primary data were created to relate the weight of each inventory item to a purse seiner's LSW. The list of inventory items (granularity) contribute >95% of environmental impacts, as described in the reference publication. The values is calculated as a weighted average from the two regional activities in Peru and Spain. Production volume was used as weight. Peruvian PV: 4212000000 kg, Spanish PV: 7000000 kg.

flow.category: A:Agriculture, forestry and fishing/03:Fishing and aquaculture/031:Fishing/0311:Marine fishing

exchanges.description: Pelagic fish discarded by fisheries. Based on Vázquez-Rowe et al. (2011) in Marine Policy, a 3.2% discard rate was assumed for this fishery. The values is calculated as a weighted average from the two regional activities in Peru and Spain. Production volume was used as weight. Peruvian PV: 4212000000 kg, Spanish PV: 7000000 kg.

Maintenance of a purse seiner, per 1000 kg of light ship weight (LSW) over 35 years lifetime. Regressions based on mainly primary data were created to relate the weight of each inventory item to a purse seiner's LSW. The list of inventory items (granularity) contribute >95% of environmental impacts, as described in the reference publication. The values is calculated as a weighted average from the two regional activities in Peru and Spain. Production volume was used as weight. Peruvian PV: 4212000000 kg, Spanish PV: 7000000 kg.
